abstract: Beating Wall Street expectations, Comcast said that its revenues increased by 3.8 percent in the first quarter of 2010, to $9.2 billion.
snippet: Beating Wall Street expectations, Comcast said that its revenues increased by 3.8 percent in the first quarter of 2010, to $9.2 billion.
lead_paragraph: Comcast said that its revenues increased by 3.8 percent in the first quarter of 2010, to $9.2 billion, beating Wall Street’s expectations.

abstract: The company’s first quarterly ad growth in two years was seen as a positive sign for the television advertising market.
snippet: The company’s first quarterly ad growth in two years was seen as a positive sign for the television advertising market.
lead_paragraph: Beating Wall Street expectations, Comcast, the nation’s largest cable company, reported strong revenue gains and a turnaround in local advertising on Wednesday.

headline.main: Comcast’s Revenue Rises 3.8% as Local Ads Start to Return
headline.print_headline: Comcast’s Revenue Rises 3.8% As Local Ads Start to Return
